Description: Bronze mirror with a handle in the form of a naked woman, shown holding a duck in her right hand. A papyrus capital shape, with incised detail, provides the transition from handle to mirror.
Curator's comments: Published: Walters, Catalogue of Bronzes, (1899), p.880. Evrard-Derriks, 'A propos des mirroirs egyptiennes a manche en forme de statuette feminine' in Revue des Archeologues et Historiens d'Art de Louvain V, (1972), p.8, Fig.7 (ill.). Putnam, Egyptology: An Introduction to the History, Culture and Art of Ancient Egypt, (1990), p.67.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
